results.title: Knole
results.creator_credit: Robert Fleming, John Rhodes and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place in the Country”.
Part of a series of films made in cooperation with the National Trust, this episode looks at Knole through the eyes of the family who has lived there.

results.title: Knockout thrills
results.brief_description: Newsreel footage capturing the closing stages of some historic boxing matches. 1. Gene Tunney versus Georges Capentier (Round 14, 24th of July 1924, Polo Grounds, New York City). 2. Harry Wills versus Paulino Uzcudun (Round 4, 13th of July 1927, Brooklyn, New York City). 3. Jack Dempsey versus Jack Sharkey (Round 6-7, 21st of July 1927, Yankee Stadium, New York City). 4. Joe Louis versus James J. Braddock (Round 7-8, 22nd of June 1937, Chicago).

results.title: Knockbacks
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Six of the best”.
Introduces issues about employers and the workplace, casual work and family relationships. Antoni finds a short lived labouring job; Brian walks off his job after an argument with the foreman; Sal is still looking for work in the face of lack of family understanding and Brian’s father is retrenched.

results.title: Knit-face
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Janet Merewether

results.title: Knights of the Round Table
results.creator_credit: Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Richard Thorpe
results.brief_description:
Based on Sir Thomas Malory’s “Le Morte D’Arthur”, this is a tale of chivalry, honour, tragic love and intrigue. At the famous Round Table, established by Arthur to uphold peace, justice and chivalry, sits the gallant Lancelot, Percival and the evil Modred, consort to Arthur’s half-sister, Morgan Le Fay, who is determined to snatch the crown and bring chaos to the realm. The powerful Merlin can do nothing to circumvent the futile love between Lancelot and Queen Guinevere, the consequences of which will not only split the kingdom, but destroy the friendship between the King and his most trusted Knight. All the pageantry and splendour of the age are here.
Cast includes: Robert Taylor, Ava Gardner, Mel Ferrer, Anne Crawford, Stanley Baker and Felix Aylmer.

results.title: Knifecraft
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Illustrates the prpoer care and handling of a pocket knife, using the carving of a Katcina Doll lamp as an example. Shows initial preparations, the whittling down of material to rough dimensions, carving detail and the painting of an Indian design to finish the lamp.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service

results.title: Knife in the water = Noz w wodzie. Repulsion. Cul-de-sac [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Zespol Camera, Compton, Stanislaw Zylewicz, Gene Gatowski and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: Roman Polanski is a true auteur. Themes of ambiguity, sexual tension, insanity, and everyday tragedy make his surrealistic work inspirational and at the same time controversial. This three disc set presents three of his 1960’s features. “Knife in the water” is Polanski’s first feature. A married couple pick up a hitch hiker. Feelings of claustrophobia and sexual tension result as they are confined on a holiday in a small yacht. A jealous husband turns hostile. In Polish with English subtitles. “Repulsion” a psychological thriller focuses on the illusions and fantasies of a sexually repressed young woman (Catherine Deneuve). Being both repulsed and attracted by sex she has nightmares and horrific visions when alone for several days in her apartment. “Cul-de-sac” a black comedy where a strangely matched couple have their home invaded by two criminals. Life is disrupted by the eccentric and interesting gangsters. Tense and surreal. Cast include Donald Pleasance and Lionel Standing. Titles available on VHS. Title numbers 304192; 315657; 302532.
